com.nexmo.sdk.verify.client

Class VerifyClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nexmo.sdk.verify.client.VerifyClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BaseClientListener

    public class VerifyClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements BaseClientListener
    The VerifyClient provides the entry point to verification flow provided by the Nexmo SDK.

    First step is to acquire a VerifyClient instance based on a built NexmoClient object. Remember to set a VerifyClientListener to receive status change notifications.

    After a new VerifyClient is created the verification can be initiated by calling getVerifiedUser(String, String).

    Example usage: 

         VerifyClient myVerifyClient = new VerifyClient(myNexmoClient);
     myVerifyClient.addVerifyListener(new VerifyClientListener() {
         @Override
         public void onVerifyInProgress(final VerifyClient verifyClient) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed. Usually provide an input field in the UI that allows PIN code input.
         }

         @Override
         public void onUserVerified(final VerifyClient verifyClient) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed.
         }

         @Override
         public void onError(final VerifyClient verifyClient, final com.nexmo.sdk.verify.event.VerifyError errorCode) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed.
         }

         @Override
         public void onException(final IOException exception) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed. Most probably there is a network connectivity exception.
         }
     }
     myVerifyClient.getVerifiedUser(myCountryCode, myPhoneNo);

    Anytime the PIN code has been received by the end user, it should be supplied to the verify client: 

         myVerifyClient.checkPinCode("pinCode");
    A successful verification will be completed once the VerifyClientListener.onUserVerified(VerifyClient) event is invoked.

    Checking if the current user is verified already or not is possible via getUserStatus(String, String, SearchListener) . Remember to set a SearchListener to receive the user status.

    Example usage: 

         VerifyClient myVerifyClient = new VerifyClient(myNexmoClient);
     myVerifyClient.isUserVerified(myCountryCode, myPhoneNo, new SearchListener() {
         @Override
         public void onUserStatus(final UserStatus userStatus) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed.
         }

         @Override
         public void onError(final com.nexmo.sdk.verify.event.VerifyError errorCode, final String errorMessage) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed.
         }

         @Override
         public void onException(IOException exception) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed. Most probably there is a network connectivity exception.
         }
     }

    Actions can be performed for the current user for controlling the verification flow. The available commands are the Command actions.

    Perform an action by calling command(String, String, com.nexmo.sdk.verify.event.Command, com.nexmo.sdk.verify.event.CommandListener) Remember to set CommandListener in order to receive command updates.

    Example usage, performing a Command.LOGOUT for an already verified user: 

         VerifyClient myVerifyClient = new VerifyClient(myNexmoClient);
     myVerifyClient.command(myCountryCode, myPhoneNo, Command.LOGOUT, new CommandListener() {
         @Override
         public void onSuccess(Command command) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed.
         }

         @Override
         public void onError(Command command, final com.nexmo.sdk.verify.event.VerifyError errorCode, String errorMessage) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed.
         }

         @Override
         public void onException(IOException exception) {
              // Update the application UI here if needed. Most probably there is a network connectivity exception.
         }
     }

      void getVerifiedUser()
      Deprecated. 
      Use getVerifiedUser(String, String) method instead and supply the user's phone number and country code. Verify the user of the current handset, with the handset SIM details.

      Verification with no supplied phone number along with country code is not permitted for SIM less handsets.

      In this case, the end user does not need to enter their own phone number, as they will be automatically read from the SIM card.

      Note: This method will only succeed if the current handset does contain a SIM card. Otherwise, please call getVerifiedUser(String, String) with values provided by the user.

      • getVerifiedUser

        public void getVerifiedUser()
        Deprecated. Use getVerifiedUser(String, String) method instead and supply the user's phone number and country code. Verify the user of the current handset, with the handset SIM details.

        Verification with no supplied phone number along with country code is not permitted for SIM less handsets.

        In this case, the end user does not need to enter their own phone number, as they will be automatically read from the SIM card.

        Note: This method will only succeed if the current handset does contain a SIM card. Otherwise, please call getVerifiedUser(String, String) with values provided by the user.

      • getVerifiedUser

        public void getVerifiedUser(java.lang.String countryCode,
                   java.lang.String phoneNumber)
        Verify the user of the current handset, with the provided country code and phone number. Retrieve a verified user object for the current handset.

        In the case of a transient (typically network related) error an InternalNetworkException will be thrown.

        Listen to VerifyClientListener events to be notified of user verify state, as well as error events.

        Parameters:
        countryCode - The country code of the current SIM card.
        phoneNumber - The phone number of the current handset. Only mobile numbers are accepted.

      • checkPinCode

        public void checkPinCode(java.lang.String pinCode)
        Check verification enables you to check whether the PIN code the ned user has provided matches the one Nexmo has sent.

        Validation on code length is made prior to checking the code against the service generated one.

        Please note that any verification pin code is valid for 15 minutes. If the user is unable to provide the pin in due time, verification will fail. In this case, the verification needs to be re-started.

        Parameters:
        pinCode - PIN code your end user has provided into your application (min 4 digits).

      • getUserStatus

        public void getUserStatus(java.lang.String countryCode,
                 java.lang.String phoneNumber,
                 SearchListener searchListener)
        Get/Search the current state of the user, with the provided country code and phone number. There is no point in making concurrent isUserVerified requests for the same user, therefore only one request at a time will be accepted.

        In the case of a transient (typically network related) error an InternalNetworkException will be thrown.

        Listen to VerifyClientListener events to be notified of user state, as well as error events.

        Parameters:
        countryCode - The country code of the current SIM card.
        phoneNumber - The phone number of the current handset. Only mobile numbers are accepted.
        searchListener - The search listener. This listener is mandatory, if it's set to null the method would fail.

      • command

        public void command(java.lang.String countryCode,
           java.lang.String phoneNumber,
           Command command,
           CommandListener commandListener)
        Initiate a command for the current user to control the verification workflow, in order to further tailor your end-user experience.

        You should only consider implementing this API if there is a strong need to change the verification process while it is underway, due to user-detected issues. In some cases, end-users may wish to manually invoke a retry - something to the effect of "Send me my code again". Normally Verify manages retry timing by automatically determining if it needs to attempt delivering the code once again. This retry is invoked if a check is not received within the average expected duration for completing a verification successfully.

        The available commands are:

        • Command.LOGOUT Once a user is in UserStatus.USER_VERIFIED state a Logout command can be performed.
        • Command.CANCEL Using command 'Cancel', an outstanding request may be cancelled and a new one issued. This approach, helps you to trigger the same channel as the first attempt, since it initiates the Verification flow all over again. This mimics the traditional "Retry" or "Correct my number" button, where a user initiates Verify for the same or a new number because something went wrong.
        • Command.TRIGGER_NEXT_EVENT Using the command 'trigger_next_event', Verify can be instructed to failover immediately, instead of waiting for the default duration. This will trigger the next attempt to deliver the verification code, typically over Text to Speech. A relatable way to think of this is a "Did not receive your SMS?" or "Call me instead" button; which may be made actionable if you determine that the phone number should have good cellular connectivity.

        Note that trying to deliver the PIN code again in a shorter duration does not necessarily translate into better conversion, it also doesn't result in a good user experience owing to the fact that users take time to complete the verification process.

        Parameters:
        countryCode - The country code of the current SIM card.
        phoneNumber - The phone number of the current handset. Only mobile numbers are accepted.
        command - The Command action to perform. The command is mandatory.
        commandListener - The command action listener. This listener is mandatory, if it's set to null the method would fail.
